visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the title 'Fruit Consumption'. The chart should have a subtitle 'Comparison of fruit consumption'. The x-axis should display categories 'Apples', 'Pears', 'Bananas', and 'Oranges'. The y-axis should display the number of fruits consumed. The data series should include one series named 'Fruits' with data [1, 4, 3, 5]. The chart should have custom colors ['#FF5733', '#33FF57', '#3357FF', '#FF33A1']. The chart should have a background color of '#F9F9F9' and a margin of 50 pixels on all sides. The legend should be positioned at the bottom of the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart with specific styling and data. The chart type is set to 'column', and it includes a title 'Fruit Consumption' and a subtitle 'Comparison of fruit consumption'. The x-axis displays categories 'Apples', 'Pears', 'Bananas', and 'Oranges', while the y-axis shows the number of fruits consumed. The data series includes one series named 'Fruits' with data [1, 4, 3, 5]. Custom colors are applied to each data point using the specified list ['#FF5733', '#33FF57', '#3357FF', '#FF33A1']. The chart has a background color of '#F9F9F9' and a margin of 50 pixels on all sides. The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally.
